Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2015
Author: Lowflyer
Title: Excellent value.
Body: These are well made and are a must-have oil for BBQing or roasting large hunk of meat. They clean up quickly and just make life easy.  If you've tried shredding pork, turkey, or chicken with two forks, it gave you cramps in your hands and forearms like it does me, these are for you.  The grips fill the palms of your hands making them comfortable and almost effortless to use. Highly recommend!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2015
Author: Robert A. Sawtelle
Title: Great Product, Great Seller
Body: GREAT KITCHEN TOOL, GREAT Seller!  I bought these specifically for doing pulled pork, but I see now how these will make pulling roasts & chickens out of the crockpot so much easier, as well as shredding any kind of meat, and even mixing my coleslaw to go with the pulled pork!I recommend these and this seller.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2014
Author: Grimthreeper
Title: best thing ever
Body: In the south we love our BBQ. And no BBQ doesn't mean anything you put on the grill. It's pulled pork off a Boston butt that has been slow smoked to perfection. These are awesome compared to the old way to pulling by hand or a regular fork. Don't hesitate just buy this product. I only wish I would've bought 2 pair. One for me and one to give away!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2015
Author: Bernadette B
Title: Fantastic product, I love using them to grab and ...
Body: Fantastic product, I love using them to grab and shred meat. I was never able to master shredding meat with forks, so this product is perfect for me. One of my favorite recent amazon purchases.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2015
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Great for Bear Impersonations
Body: OK.  Maybe bear impersonations are not your thing, but these pulled pork shredders are just fun to use.  Much sharper than I expected a non-metal shredder could be.  They fit my medium sized hands just fine.  Grip the meat really well.  Paid for themselves the first time they let me pull a Pork Butt off the smoker before my hands even got warm!  Makes fast work of pork pulling too!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2014
Author: Kimberly K Ross
Title: Great Product
Body: I happened to see these while looking for BBQ accessories. They arrived quickly and were packaged nicely.I used them for the first time today to pull some pork butts.  They worked fantastically.  I was able to very quickly shred the meat into very fine pieces.  I also used them to lift the meat from the smoker.  This worked much better than tongs or meat forks.I recommend these to any serious barbecuer.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2015
Author: Tammy A.
Title: easy on the hands
Body: I like to make pulled pork and these claws cut my prep time from an hour to 10 minutes. I have arthritis in my hands so the claws are a tremendous help. I also used them to pick up large hunks of meat from the crock pot. They're much sturdier than a fork or tongs. Clean up nicely in the dishwasher too.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2014
Author: macomb
Title: Excellent product
Body: These claws are wonderful.  They shred pork so easy.  Wish I would of had them years ago.  Arrived packaged well and very quickly.  Highly recommend the kitchen claws.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2014
Author: Jackie
Title: Love these forks
Body: Love these forks!  They worked very well for pulled pork and for shredding chicken too!I bought 7 of them for Christmas presents.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2015
Author: Jason Goodin
Title: Rip Meat Like an Alaskan Grizzly
Body: When you want to tear meat apart like a wild, carnal, ruler-of-wild Alaskan domains grizzly bear, buy these. And when you want to just be the hero of the local BBQ scene, buy another pair to share.I tend to rate my convenience purchases in terms of whether the time saved using the convenience item was enough to justify the expense for it. Wow. I easily saved 40 minutes of time shredding pulled pork the very first time using these claws. That's an easy justification of the $15 in itself, let alone the amount I'll use them hereafter. They're such a simple concept, but are done well--good ergonomics, the meat doesn't get caught in the claws, quality construction, and a fair price. I really should have ordered a set of these a long time ago.Perhaps I'll have to order another set and use them as part of a grizzly costume this Halloween. Yup, I like 'em that much. Raawwwrrrr.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2014
Author: Sue
Title: Everyone can use these!
Body: Thought these would be a perfect gift for my brother, who is a big fan of making pulled pork. After reading other reviews, I realized I could use these for salad - so got a pair for myself too! Bottom line: These kitchen claws are a multi-purpose kitchen tool that everyone will use.Super quick delivery, and easy to clean too.  I'd recommend to any and all!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2015
Author: Lori L
Title: I bought this set for my husband who loves to cook and BBQ. He loves it!!
Body: I bought this set for my husband who loves to cook and BBQ. He loves it!! It is so easy to use and clean. Will certainly be considering this for future gifts :-) Company is also fantastic, sent along some really great recipes we are looking forward to trying out. Highly recommend this product and this company! Cheers, Lori :-)

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2014
Author: Brandy Duink
Title: These are great. The concept is great all the way to ...
Body: These are great. The concept is great all the way to execution, within minutes these go from a cute novelty gift to something you can find a reasons to use every single day. So very useful.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2014
Author: Abraham L. Maioho, JrAbraham L. Maioho, Jr
Title: WOW!
Body: We did a Hawaiian Style Luau and cooked 164 pounds of pork butts.  We were able to shred all 164 pounds in less than half the time it would have taken us using conventional carving tools.  We have also used the claws for tossing our salads, moving beef roasts from one pan to another and deboning chicken.  Wish we had this years ago.  The quality of the claws are excellent.  Mahalo Kitchen Ready, for your claws.Update - March 23, 2015We made Pulled Pork Sandwiches and Mac Salad for dinner the other night.  40 seconds to remove from pan and shred.  These Kitchen Claws are fantastic and are getting well used! Thank you!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2015
Author: Maggie Smith
Title: No brainier!!
Body: These are perfect for those of us who like to use slow cookers to cook meat. They are also very useful to shred beer butt chicken off the grill. Best part is you can shred meat in the actual crock pot or cooking dish without any damage to the surface because they are durable plastic. These would make for a great present. When you're done, just rinse off and throw them in the dishwasher!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2014
Author: Hawkeye 19
Title: Shredding made simple
Body: Seller called to insure item was as advertised. I have inspected this item and found it to be of high quality. I will be using it this weekend, and expect it to perform as advertised.  This company states they are developing new kitchen products.  Looking forward to their next product.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2014
Author: Erin E
Title: Great product!
Body: What a clever invention these are -- I wish I had thought of it!  I make pulled pork quite often and these have definitely made the shredding part a lot easier!  I will also use them to toss salads.  Perfectly sized for adult hands.

Author: trianglemouse
Title: Five Stars
Body: Very happy with purchase. Great communication and follow up. Quick shipping.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2015
Author: Powersaw
Title: Amazingly simple, amazingly awesome!
Body: I bought these claws for the hubby, who is the family chef. We used them for the first time on Christmas day to move the ham from the roasting pan to the cutting board. We've since used them to pick up turkey, shred beef, and most recently to shred pork. They are amazingly simple, yet amazingly awesome. I cannot believe in the past we've bent forks and knives, burned hands, made unnecessary messes and had the occasional dropped on the floor casualty, when we could have had these. Excellent price for the benefit received. Plus, the company sent a great follow-up email after shipment confirmation giving us ideas on how to use these claws. Excellent buying experience. Would totally buy again.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2015
Author: amichalares
Title: These things are freaking awesome. Not only do they look bad as heck
Body: These things are freaking awesome.  Not only do they look bad as heck, and very strong for being plastic (it's not a cheap plastic, it's sturdy).I used to slow cook a pork shoulder and then use forks to shred... it took me like 30 minutes to shred before - with the shredder "claws" I was tearing apart a shoulder in no time, and I felt like wolverine when I did it.Also, I've used these to pick up big hunks of meat from the crock pot or the smoker grill, just stab them in and you're good to go.A+ product.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2015
Author: Tara Johnson
Title: I love pulled pork and chicken and noodles so I ordered ...
Body: Searching for an electric roaster these kitchen claws were displayed below in the "customers also bought this" section. I love pulled pork and chicken and noodles so I ordered them right away. I am so glad I did! I used them to shred a pork loin and with the kitchen claws it made the shredding so much easier than my old method of using two forks. No one wants to spend forever shredding hot meat with forks, get these and you won't have to.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2015
Author: Niloc Nosnibor
Title: Shredding meat is fun now
Body: These things are AMAZING! So far I've just used it to tear apart a 5 lbs. pork shoulder and it was really fun. I would recommend keeping the majority of your un-shredded meat on a separate cutting board surface and transferring smaller pieces at a time to a secondary cutting board on which you shred the meat, then ultimately transfer it to a serving dish, tupperware, etc. I am excited to try these on chicken next.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2015
Author: Shane J. Chaplin
Title: Must Have!!!!!
Body: These claws work awesome!!! I smoked a 14lb pork butt last week. It took me less than 5 min to shred it up.  I had people over watching this that all commented that they need a pair.  I would buy a spare pair just to have around at this price.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2014
Author: sandra l. klint
Title: This company offers excellent customer service(I didn't contact them
Body: What a pleasant experience!This company offers excellent customer service(I didn't contact them,they contacted me to see if I had any questions or concerns)I didn't.The product is very well constructed to last for years.Just what I needed to shred leftovers or to handle a large pork carnitas.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2015
Author: Judy Schreiner
Title: Crazy about the Claws
Body: I ordered the Kitchen Claws for my daughter as a stocking stuffer for Christmas. She loves to make pulled pork  and she absolutely loves these Claws!!  I mean she LOVES THEM! I may need to order a pair for myself!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2014
Author: B. R. Reed
Title: I'm going to need to make more pulled pork!
Body: These arrived in the mail very quickly. I've used them on a pork shoulder to make pulled pork and it was a snap! Much faster than using a knife and your fingers. The forks are made of a hard plastic. Don't be deceived though, they are more than sharp enough to get the job done. I was able to use them to lift a full chicken from the roster to the cutting board. FYI these went through the dishwasher just fine.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2014

Title: Bought as a gift

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2014

Title: Great Product!
Body: After reading great reviews about Kitchen Claws, we decided to order. Upon arrival, we weren't quite sure how often we would actually use them but they are extremely convenient. I have used them on different occasions such as for shredding chicken breast and for roast. When holding the claws, they easily fit into your hands to lift meat out of the pot, clawing for shredding, and lifting onto a serving tray. We love them and highly recommend.

Title: Very satisfied
Body: I saw these and had been looking for a better way to handle a tenderloin roast and or pulled pork from pork shoulder. They are very diverse in the number of uses and wash up perfectly. They have worked very well and are very sturdy. I liked them so well, I bought two more for holiday gifts! Shipped promptly and arrived in perfect condition! Great product.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2014
Author: Mark Meyers
Title: Y'all got to have a pair of these!
Body: These claws are an awesome addition to my outdoor kitchen.  Don't know how y'all prepare your pulled pork but this will be the way I do mine from now on.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2015
Author: Brittney
Title: My husband thinks he's Wolverine.
Body: What a great product.  My husband was thrilled with these, as he and his family have all been pretty big on cooking and food prep for their entire lives.  There are PLENTY of family members, and so any time you have a holiday or cookout, you're going to be making food on a large scale.  With these claws, pulled pork sandwiches for a family get together is no sweat. Really, the only part we have to worry about now is how we're gonna cook it, and how we're gonna transport it. They take up almost zero space in the kitchen drawer, and nothing else we've got does the job that these do. They are quite sharp, so please be careful. Handle with care, like you would any sharp utensil.Now that we've got these claws, I know exactly what a couple of upcoming gifts to in-laws and friends will be.  Even my mother has considered swiping these!  They really do create their own new customers with this product; all someone has to do is use it.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2014

Title: Great product!
Body: I highly recommend kitchen claws for every kitchen.  I have used them for shredding chicken, which has made it so easy and fast. Much better than using 2 forks!  I have also used them for tossing cole slaw and other salads.  They are also very helpful for transferring large cuts of meat.  I have purchased more to give to my adult children.  They would make great hostess gifts.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2014

Title: seems of high quality and a good value. The tines are nice a sturdy and ...
Body: Product arrived quickly as described, seems of high quality and a good value.  The tines are nice a sturdy and make short work of a hunk of meat! Highly recommend purchase for those who like pulled pork or chicken and want something better than forks.

Body: Well made, sharp enough to do the job but not so much that you'll slice yourself up.  Dishwasher safe is a nice plus.  Does the job, quickly and effectively.

Author: BVGBVG
Title: Strong but not solid
Body: Though these look and feel very strong i have returned due to all the small crevices on the back side ( not shown in pictures) as these will be difficult to clean if you do not have a dishwasher. I was expecting a solid piece of material.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2014
Author: Dale Vink
Title: Kitchen Claws are Great addition to my kitchen.
Body: Wow, what a great find. Such a versitile product for the kitchen.  I have used my claws on the grill and in the kitchen for preparing meat and salads. The claws do not transfer heat and clean up easily.  My order came quickly and everything looked great and worked as advertised. I highly recommend this great product, it will make great gifts this holiday season.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2015
Author: robert dixon
Title: These things are AMAZING! I used to have to shred my meat ...
Body: These things are AMAZING! I used to have to shred my meat (Pork, Turkey, Chicken or Beef) with 2 forks and it was a pain in my back. Literally, I have a spinal chord injury and it would cause me so much pain to fork my meat that I would have to do it in stages and it would take a couple of hours. I got these Shredder Claws and I am AMAZED! I can shred a 4lb Pork Roast in less than 15 minutes! A healthy person could probably do it a lot faster. I absolutely LOVE them! Thank you so much for making them.P.S.  They also make me feel like I am "Wolverine" with my claws out. :-D

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2016
Author: Scott
Title: These claws seem sturdy and sharp
Body: These claws seem sturdy and sharp, and, although they are not especially large, they fit my biggish hands well enough. (I'm 6'2".)The ribbon printed on the box covers some of the text, including part of the cleaning instructions, but not so much that I couldn‚Äôt figure it out easily.If you smoke a lot of meat it might be worth it to get a more expensive pair, but for somebody like me who shreds meat several times a year but not all the time, these were a good deal. I look forward to giving them a frequent workout.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2014
Author: Barbiek
Title: Great Must Have kitchen tool!!!
Body: This is such a great tool for tossing salads, holding roasts and chicken while carving, shredding pork and chicken.  It is sturdy, easy to grasp and SHARP.  These will be used on a regular basis and not put in the drawer for special uses.Update:"I just bought a second and third pair of Kitchen Claws. One was for my second home and the other was for a Christmas gift. These are so handy to have and use! Instead of slicing slices off a whole turkey or chicken turkey or chicken, I can remove the whole breast at once and then slice it as I see fit! Great tools!!! And sturdy!!!"

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2015
Author: Cooking Heaven
Title: Can't teach an old dog new tricks
Body: Tried these on 15lbs of pork butt. They're ok...nothing amazing. Kind of awkward. I'd probably just go back to putting on gloves and using a large fork and ripping it all apart.Built very well, sharp points and nicely designed. maybe just not for me.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2015
Author: C. D. Kendrick
Title: Great time saver!
Body: These claws are great!  We used them for picking up the whole turkey out of the roasting pan to carve it.  We also have used these to shred chicken and pulled pork.  You can shred just about any meat, and you don't have to let it cool first.  This is a huge time saver, and I need that in the kitchen!  They are pretty heavy duty for shredding.  They make much quicker work out of your meal than trying to use a couple of forks.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2023
Author: Melissa W.
Title: Fun and useful
Body: Got these as a gift for my husband and we loved them. Fun, does a great job shredding meat, and they‚Äôre easy to clean.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2015
Author: JLS
Title: Works well for the stated purpose, fun at parties, strange to clean.
Body: Works well for the stated purpose, fun at parties, strange to clean.The claws make it very easy to pull large pieces of meat out of a crock pot or roasting pan without the worrying about dropping it.I'm not going to lie. "Rawr, I've got claws!" factor gives these things a lot of appeal.The only real problem I've had with the claws is that the claws aren't solid on the back. They aren't thin or flimsy by any means, but on the reverse side of each claw there are depressions (1/4" or larger) that get full of grease, seasonings, etc, and they can be a little annoying to clean because they are deep and narrow enough that a regular kitchen brush won't get to the cracks. You have to get in there with a toothbrush or use something to scrape them out.I do like them, and I do recommend them if you often worry about dropping your entrees on the floor.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019
Author: sweethrt
Title: Better than using a fork!
Body: Would have given 5 stars but they are a little awkward and take some getting used to. They work great though. It makes it not only easier to shred meat, but pick it up as well. I have carpal tunnel in my right arm and a bad wrist on my left. Using a fork causes me a lot of pain, but these shed the meat faster and it doesn't hurt to use them. Great for BBQ pork, pork roast, and beef roast. (I haven't tried it on chicken yet.)

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2015
Author: Sam I Am
Title: Great so far
Body: My husband and I love to smoke and grill food on our Yoder pellet grill.  Having a tool like this makes it easy to remove those 8 pound pork shoulders and those 7-8 pound turkey breasts.  It also makes quick work of shredding the meat.  I was a little apprehensive about buying something like this that wasn't metal, but these are sturdy and make easy work of the two 8 pound pork shoulders we smoked for Christmas.  Time will tell how long they last, but my guess is I'll have these shredder claws for a long time.  I would recommend to friends and family and I would buy from this seller again.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2015
Author: BeenThere
Title: A Must-Have kitchen tool!
Body: Finally got a chance to use our Claws..we smoked 2 pork butts this weekend. They worked GREAT when we had to transfer the butts off of the smoker grill EARLY because the heating element DIED!! Fortunately we were done smokin' & finished the heating in the oven for another 2 hours....And the Claws did a FANTASTIC job shredding the butts once they were done. It was definitely the best method we've used so far to get the meat shredded up perfectly. We highly recommend these Claws; they also did a great job shredding skinned pork sausages to use in recipes.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2015
Author: viperccp
Title: Versatile Claws
Body: The claws arrived on time but I was a bit surprised to find they were plastic. My wife ordered them and they looked like metal on the website, guess I should have read the details. Nevertheless, they were very handy for pulling the tri-tip off the roasting rack and did a good job holding the meat as I sliced it with an electric knife. I have not yet used it for shredding, but it seems sturdy enough to do a great job, especially if the meat is tender. This also would make a great gift as well for any meat lover.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2016
Author: Danyelle
Title: Good for pulled pork.
Body: I bought these to use to easily shred up pulled pork.  They worked great, but couldn't be used in a bowl like I usually use to shred with forks.  Next time I will try it on a platter instead.  They are sharper than I had thought they would be, the plastic seemed thin, but it worked fine for shredding a big pork roast.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2015
Author: Keith
Title: If you only do pulled pork once a year then ...
Body: If you only do pulled pork once a year then you NEED these! I used them yesterday on two 12 lb pork butts and I completely shredded them in less than 10 minutes. This usually takes me at least 30 minutes by hand.  Also, I never even came close to burning my fingers while using these where I always burn my fingers when using BBQ gloves because they can only protect you from the heat for a minute or two at a time.Bottom line: get these shredder claws!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2015
Author: Kathryn.House
Title: Not just for meat
Body: These were purchased as a last minute gift for my dad - what do you get your older father who has everything and gets whatever he wants?While these are not recommended for dishwashers, we found that a hot sink soak does the trick if you clean them after you use them, and they have other uses outside shredding pork or brisket.  They are great salad tossers, potato piercers, and dough breakers (when you have to divide dough for a recipe).  They seem fragile when you use them, but they seem to hold up pretty well!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2016
Author: Cheryl F. Williams
Title: Good to Handle
Body: Wanted these because I am trying to get my pork CHOPS LOL. Needed to get that pork shoulder out of the pot and shred it for pulled pork.  Very pleased with these claws and even more excited that the have very little weight and can be used for tossed salads, and other tossing circumstances.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2016
Author: Kristina Franks
Title: These work great to shred meat
Body: These work great to shred meat. My husband has only used it on chicken, but he really likes them. I was worried at first that they would be too small for his hands (which are much larger than mine) but they work great!After I ordered, I received follow up emails from the company to ensure I had received the product. It was nice to know that they want to make sure their customers are happy!

Also it should also come in handy for picking up the Thanksgiving Turkey and the Easter Ham.And to stabilize both for slicing.

They are very sturdy and the points are sharp. Can't wait to try on the turkey at Thanksgiving. Seller was very kind and I would highly recommend this seller and product.  "

Body: The picture is for size. They are more bigger than I imagined. These are wonderful. I can't wait to use them. Took one day. I hope you enjoy them the way I will. Great product!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2014
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Looks very nice and sturdy
Body: Looks very nice and sturdy. This is a christmas present for my husband so we will know more on how these work and hold up to shredding pork roasts and beef roasts we make all the time. Thought it was a great idea instead of using 2 forks that don't shred much meat at a time. Keep you posted!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2015
Author: The Dawg
Title: Great prop for you B grade Kung Fu movie (Pretty good for meat too)
Body: These work great for pulling pork with one caveat the meat has to be well done. I cook my pork butt in a big green egg for 8-14 hours. If you simply cook the meat to 160 degrees it is too tough to pull, but when slow cooked until tender, the shred easily.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2016
Author: Mooresville Lady & Gentleman
Title: Finally!!
Body: Shredded an 8 pound Boston Butt a few weeks ago with forks and was almost too tired to eat. This time I used the claws and it was fast and easy. Looking forward to using them with the NC slaw. Should of bought two pair....

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2016
Author: Sourgrapes
Title: Works wonders in the kitchen!
Body: I bough these to assist me with a large turkey on the grill and ended up using them for everything!!  They are helpful turning meat (spiral ham, whole turkey) in the oven, crock pot and on the grill.  I also use them to shred up chicken, work great.  I am really surprised at how much I use these!  Great purchase, dishwasher safe.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2019

Title: Wonderful Tool
Body: My husband smokes meat and I gave these as a Father's Day gift. He loves them and said whoever designed these must smoke meat because they are the perfect tool for the job.

Title: Fantastic product! Recommend!
Body: These arrived at lightning speed, and made the job of shredding our 10 hr slow-cooked pork butt a literal breeze. I'd just done a recipe making shredded chicken the week before, shredding with two forks, and it took forever and was a lot of mess for little result. These claws are a great invention and stellar purchase!

Title: Works decently
Body: The product works great for Pulled Pork, and that is about it. I have tried shredding other foods but this item is designed for meat. Also, the handle is a bit difficult to grip; if the handle hand tiny grooves for the fingures or something less smooth this item would be ideal.
